message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CVPR

Reasoning: The paper deals with incorporating visual saliency and scene parsing into Direct Sparse Odometry (DSO) for accurate and robust visual odometry in cluttered indoor scenes. This involves the use of deep learning-based approaches for visual saliency and scene parsing, which falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The application of this technique to robotics for mapping and localization falls under the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. The joint optimization of semantic labels and obtaining odometry also involves the use of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents extensive quantitative evaluation and comparisons with state-of-the-art approaches, which is relevant to the computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CVPR) sub-category.
